items.content_html: This post‚Äôs filename includes a manually set date. (Sort of. ‚ÄúTODAY‚Äù in the template-source‚Äôs filename isn‚Äôt actually a Plerd keyword; Plerd‚Äôs tests just know to replace it with a today‚Äôs ymd string, when creating the test source directory.)
items.title: A source file with a manual filename

items.content_html:
This file, which is awesome, sets up some attributes that should cause some social media tags to get created in the resulting HTML, under the right circumstances.

Furthermore, it refers to a post-specific image. But it doesn‚Äôt specify a description!

It also leads with an image tag hanging out all by itself, which Plerd ought not to consider a paragraph of body text.
items.title: Metatags with image and alt

items.content_html:
This file sets up some attributes that should cause some social media tags to get created in the resulting HTML, under the right circumstances.

Furthermore, it refers to a post-specific image. But it doesn‚Äôt specify a description! It does have a hyperlink in the first paragraph, though.
items.title: Metatags with image
